intro: Sida pubescens, commonly known as the hairy sida, is a flowering plant species native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist environments such as wetlands and marshes. Sida pubescens is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid, nutrient-rich soils.
